messages.title: A Better Plan. A Better Future for Worcester
messages.content: Protect the NHS Reduce tuition fees and improve GP access Tackle the growing housing list

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protect the NHS and improve GP access
Lower pay in Worcester by tackling the minimum wage and provide more security with regular working hours
Create secure jobs and boost small businesses in Worcestershire to ensure people have good jobs with regular quality wages
Help working parents with 25 hours of free childcare starting for 3-4 year olds and improved wraparound care
Take immigration control and getting tough on benefits

issues.economy: Lower pay in Worcester by tackling the minimum wage
issues.health: Protect the NHS and improve GP access
issues.immigration: Take immigration control and getting tough on benefits

leaflet.personalStatement: I have made a difference in my working life for over 20 years at the University Lecturer helping part time students return to study to kick start their careers, made a difference for children and families in our city.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helping part time students return to study to kick start their careers
Making a difference to people's everyday lives by fighting for NHS, minimum wage and providing 25 hours a week free childcare

quotes.text: Labour's local pledges for Worcester: Plan for the long term, balancing the books without slashing essential services. Labour will back small businesses to create more apprenticeships. Labour will work to ease traffic congestion in the city. Labour will lead the development of Worcester as a city attractive to tourists. Labour will take action to improve safety in the City Centre and local neighbourhoods.
